blocks.text: The Yaesu FTX-1 is an HF/50/144/430 MHz all-mode transceiver available in two configurations: FTX-1 Field for portable operation (6W on battery, 10W on external DC), and FTX-1 Optima for base station use (100W HF/50 MHz, 50W VHF/UHF).

The FTX-1 Field includes the SBR-52LI lithium-ion battery pack providing approximately 9 hours of operation on HF SSB at 6W. The optional FC-80 antenna tuner can be mounted simultaneously with the battery. QRP mode limits output to 5W on all bands.
The FTX-1 Optima features a detachable panel that can be mounted on a stand. It includes a 66mm, 2.5W speaker on the rear for ample volume during fixed station operation.

The 4.3-inch TFT touch screen displays operating functions graphically with 3DSS spectrum display. The Filter Function Display shows WIDTH, SHIFT, NOTCH, and CONTOUR status at a glance along with the RF spectrum.

Dual band reception is supported (HF/VHF or HF/UHF) with simultaneous C4FM digital playback. The PMG (Primary Memory Group) function monitors up to 5 VHF/UHF channels with real-time bar graph display.
Simultaneous reception of HF/HF is not supported. Super-DX function increases RF amplifier sensitivity for weak signals. MAG (Memory Auto Grouping) automatically categorizes memory channels by band.
Access settings by pressing the [FUNC] knob. Navigate using touch or the knob. The menu system is consistent with other Yaesu SDR transceivers.

blocks.name: DIMMER
blocks.description: Adjusts display brightness. Found in DISPLAY settings.

blocks.name: CONTRAST
blocks.description: Adjusts display contrast. Found in DISPLAY settings.

blocks.name: PMG Settings
blocks.description: Registers up to 5 VHF/UHF frequencies (108-470 MHz) for Primary Memory Group monitoring.

blocks.name: M-GRP (Memory Group)
blocks.description: Registers frequently used memory channels for quick access. Separate from automatic MAG grouping.

blocks.name: AMS (Automatic Mode Select)
blocks.description: Automatically switches between C4FM digital and analog FM based on received signal. For VHF/UHF operation.

blocks.name: QRP Mode
blocks.description: Limits maximum transmission output to 5W on all bands. Useful for QRP contests.

blocks.name: PRESET
blocks.description: Configures settings for data modes (FT8/RTTY/PSK). Change preset for optimal digital operation.

blocks.text: Connect a paddle or straight key to the KEY jack. The built-in electronic keyer supports iambic and straight key operation. CW Spotting (zero-beating) with ZIN and SPOT functions helps tune to received signals.

blocks.name: Keyer Speed
blocks.description: Adjusts electronic keyer speed in WPM.

blocks.name: Keyer Weight
blocks.description: Sets the dot/dash ratio for personalized timing.

blocks.name: Keyer Polarity
blocks.description: Reverses dot and dash paddles if needed.

blocks.name: Keyer Mode
blocks.description: Selects operating mode: Straight, Bug, Iambic A, or Iambic B.

blocks.name: CW Delay Time
blocks.description: Sets break-in delay time for semi break-in operation.

blocks.name: Sidetone Level
blocks.description: Adjusts CW sidetone audio level.

blocks.text: Contest Memory Keyer and TEXT Memory store CW messages for contest operation. Messages can be programmed using paddle input.
DSP interference removal functions are accessed via the menu system. The Filter Function Display provides visual feedback of all DSP settings.

blocks.name: SHIFT
blocks.description: Moves the IF passband to eliminate interference on one side.

blocks.name: WIDTH
blocks.description: Narrows bandwidth to extract weak signals from interference.

blocks.name: NOTCH
blocks.description: Eliminates narrow heterodyne interference from the passband.

blocks.name: CONTOUR
blocks.description: Provides gentle DSP passband shaping. Adjustable GAIN and bandwidth (Q) for effective noise reduction.

blocks.name: APF
blocks.description: Audio Peak Filter narrows audio passband around CW pitch frequency.

blocks.name: DNR (Digital Noise Reduction)
blocks.description: 15-step adjustable noise reduction for different noise types.

blocks.name: DNF (Digital Notch Filter)
blocks.description: Automatic tracking filter that attenuates multiple interfering beat signals.

blocks.name: IPO
blocks.description: Intercept Point Optimization maximizes dynamic range and reduces impact of strong signals on low bands.

blocks.text: FTX-1 Field operates from the SBR-52LI battery (10.8V) or external DC 13.8V. FTX-1 Optima operates from external DC 13.8V +/-15%.
Battery operation provides approximately 9 hours on HF SSB at 6W (5W in QRP mode). When using external DC, output increases to 10W (6W on 70 MHz).
For continuous data transmission with external power, the optional SCF-1 cooling fan can be attached for efficient heat dissipation.
Multiple antenna tuner options are supported. The FC-80 automatic tuner can be mounted on FTX-1 Field simultaneously with the battery pack for portable operation.
The FC-40 external automatic antenna tuner connects to FTX-1 Optima for wire antenna matching. Configure the transceiver settings for FC-40 operation.
The ATAS-120A active-tuning antenna system is supported for mobile operation. Connect to FTX-1 and configure transceiver settings. Manual tuning is also available.
Set up the appropriate tuner in the menu before operation. Each tuner has specific interconnection and setup requirements.

rows.name: Operating Modes
rows.value: CW, AM, LSB, USB, FM, C4FM

blocks.name: Reset microprocessor
blocks.description: Reset options available to restore factory defaults if experiencing unusual behavior.

blocks.name: Battery charging
blocks.description: Charge the SBR-52LI battery pack. Monitor battery level on display. Use external DC for extended operation.

blocks.name: Dual band reception issues
blocks.description: HF/HF simultaneous reception is not supported. Use HF/VHF or HF/UHF combinations only.

blocks.name: PMG not scanning
blocks.description: Register frequencies (108-470 MHz) to PMG slots. Up to 5 channels can be monitored simultaneously.

blocks.name: C4FM mode issues
blocks.description: Enable AMS for automatic mode switching. Verify communication mode is not fixed to FM only.

blocks.name: Overheating during data modes
blocks.description: Attach optional SCF-1 cooling fan for continuous data transmission with external power source.

blocks.name: microSD card issues
blocks.description: Format microSD card using radio's format function. Used for settings backup, audio recording, and firmware updates.

blocks.name: Bluetooth connection
blocks.description: Install optional BU-6 Bluetooth unit for wireless headset connectivity.
